value.title: AI Ethics Keeps Relentlessly Asking Or Imploring How To Adequately Control AI, Including The Matter Of AI That Drives Self-Driving Cars
value.excerpt: The AI Control Problem is what keeps AI ethics up at night, for which paths to solving the pressing issue are discussed, along with examples from AI-based self-driving cars.

value.title: Artificial intelligence is everywhere now. This report shows how we got here.
value.excerpt: Stanford's new report reveals what artificial intelligence is capable of these days, and how widely used it is.

value.title: Stanford report shows that ethics challenges continue to dog AI field as funding climbs
value.excerpt: A report from Stanford's Human-Centered AI institute shows that AI remains dogged by ethical and bias challenges, but that funding is increasing.

value.title: Despite AI race hype, US and China make a formidable AI tag team
value.excerpt: With all the talk about competition between the U.S. and China to dominate AI advancement, it turns out researchers in both countries work together. A lot.

value.title: AI Ethics And The Riddle Underlying Criminal Accountability Of AI, Including Crimes Committed By Revered AI-Based Self-Driving Cars
value.excerpt: Ethical AI is contending with whether or not AI ought to be criminally accountable, which can be illustrated via crimes potentially committed via AI self-driving cars.

value.title: Ethics of Artificial Intelligence on the top. Another take on the draft artificial intelligence regulation. Significant changes

value.title: AI Ethics Foresees Potential Bad Blood And Feuding Between Humans And AI In An Us Versus Them Daily Tussle, Maybe...
value.excerpt: AI ethics warns us of bad blood and feuds that can arise from an us-versus-them human mindset, illustrated via the possible wrong way of adopting AI-based self-driving cars.

value.title: 4 tips to responsibly and ethically implement AI for hiring
value.excerpt: How do companies ensure that their AI technology is improving the ethics and equity of their hiring process, not hindering it?

value.title: In the metaverse, responsible AI must be a priority
value.excerpt: Language technology powered by AI can perpetuate bias if we are not careful. We need to be sure that language AI is trained to be ethical as well.

value.title: AI Weekly: The Russia-Ukraine conflict is a test case for AI in warfare
value.excerpt: The Russia-Ukraine conflict is a proving ground for AI technologies applied to warfare. Already, the impacts are coming into clear view.

value.title: Tesla and the ethics of self-driving cars
value.excerpt: Self-driving technology has come a long way in recent years, but it remains far from perfect. And that's partially because of decisions made -- not by the cars -- but by programmers.

value.title: Why AI and Robotics are the Key to True Digital Transformation
value.excerpt: Artificial Intelligence (AI) and robotics are terms used to describe machines with human-like abilities, or the simulation of natural intelligence in machines, that is programmed to learn and mimic the actions of humans.

value.title: AI Deciding How To Distribute Harm Breeds Dicey AI Ethics Dilemma, Markedly So For Nascent AI-Based Self-Driving Cars
value.excerpt: AI systems are having to ascertain how to distribute harm, a decidedly Ethical AI issue, including for the case of AI self-driving cars.

value.title: AI and the Non-Technical Humans
value.excerpt: Since Alan Touring offered up the idea of machines that might think like humans, artificial intelligence (AI) has fascinated many and frightened more than a few. AI is a specter that could ruin the human race.

value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence engineering brings together various disciplines to tame the AI hype, while providing a clearer path to realising value.

value.excerpt: IRCAI ( International Research Center on Artificial Intelligence) under the auspices of UNESCO, launched an unprecedented program to identify the global top 10 AI solutions supporting the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).

value.title: The Strategic Building Blocks Of Ethical AI: Representation, Governance And Leadership
value.excerpt: Consider three fundamental strategies needed to achieve fairness in AI development and use: executive leader readiness, representation of women and people of color and stakeholder governance.
